revisions.rev:
{{No footnotes|date=January 2008}} {{BLP sources|date=January 2008}} {{Infobox person | image = | imagesize = | name = Phina Oruche | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|8|31|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Liverpool]], England }} '''Phina Oruche''' (born 31 August 1972) is a British [[actress]], radio presenter and former model best known for her performances as [[Liberty Baker]] in [[ITV]]'s ''[[Footballers' Wives]]'', for which she won a Screen Nations Award for Favourite TV Star. Oruche was born in [[Liverpool]], England. On 29 March 2010, it was revealed she was cast to play a mother of a new family in teen soap [[Hollyoaks]].<ref>http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a211351/footballers-wives-actress-joins-hollyoaks.html</ref>
She appeared in the 6th series of ''[[I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!]]''. Phina ran the 2007 and 2006 [[London Marathon]]s raising [[Pound Sterling|Â£]]35,000 for the [[Anthony Nolan Trust]]. She has also appeared in ''[[The Bill]]'', ''[[Nip/Tuck]]'', ''[[Charmed]]'', ''[[Buffy the Vampire Slayer (TV series)|Buffy the Vampire Slayer]]'', ''[[Diagnosis Murder]]'', ''[[NYPD Blue]]'', ''[[The Forsaken (film)|The Forsaken]]'', ''[[The Unit]]'' and "Happy Ever Afters"
A former model, she represented [[Gap (clothing)|GAP]] for five years in the USA, and was featured as a cover model on magazines in the 1990s. She has also made a cameo appearance in [[Little Miss Jocelyn]] which aired in Britain on [[BBC2]] in January 2008.
A published writer, Oruche contributes to the Liverpool Echo amongst many others. She is also in the process of penning her first book . Phina also has a film company called Ibo Girl Films Ltd., for which she directs, edits and produces digital shorts and videos between TV and Film projects.
Recently Oruche spent some time between Los Angeles and Dublin. In Dublin she presented a show three days a week on [[Ireland AM]] for TV3 and in London was the "Babe in the Booth" for the week starting 29 April 2008 on the morning discussion programme, [[The Wright Stuff]].
Phina now lives in her native Liverpool where she is presenting and producing the Saturday night radio programme ''Upfront'' on [[BBC Radio Merseyside]].
Phina has been married to her longtime boyfriend in August 2007. The spouses have one child.
